They were old police cars the city of Chicago was retiring. Instead of 
being turned into taxi cabs, the movie producers bought them. This is a 
common practice when filming movies.

comments.author: bullss21

comments.text:
+netrioter Yup....They did that.  It was rumored that they took out a 
couple of those steel girders under the L and paid big time to replace 
them.  They indeed did those shots at speed.  The actual Dodge that the 
bros were driving DID have suspension mods for this scene.  And they 
wrecked about 30 others, not including the police cars intentionally 
trashed.  The budget for this flick was insane.

comments.author: Lee Anderson

comments.text:
All those dodge Polaris. man what a shame. They most likely had 318 in 
them. Now the blues mobile you know had a 440 in it.It was a fun movie. 
 the dry humor was great. Loved the Penguin scene. Yah, the nuns were 
tough. We had a few just like her. They could flat out whoop your ass. 
 Sister John Claire. She had a lot of brothers. Didn't take any 
shit......even from the eight graders.  5foot 5inches of of pure fury. But 
she also loved us.  We need the nuns back.  Sister Collette. What a Babe. 
Tough as nails too. Ah the days at Christ King School﻿

Well the night after Jake got out of jail. Edwood ran tough a red light and 
the cops pulled him over. And take his drivers license and ran the 
computor. They find out his license was suspended. And it always said that 
he had outstanding worret's. So after he founded that out that he just toke 
off. If he did not take off they would had just arrested him. And take the 
car away. So that means the band would had not be able to play. And i don't 
know about Jake!!

comments.text:

comments.author: Diego Delavega

comments.text:
i think they had something like 5 Bluesmobiles and a ton of newer ones,like 
what the CPD was driving. Chicago just switched to the Diplomat/Gran Fury 
so these were surplus cars. The Bluesmobile was a former California Highway 
Patrol car....so it was set up for high speed pursuit. I guess they had a 
service shop that ran 24/7 fixing these cars for shoots
comments.author: netrioter

comments.text:
Great Stunt drivers...just the absurdity of the Blues mobile making those 
insane jumps with out 'ramps" still one of the greatest chase scenes ever!
comments.author: Diego Delavega

comments.text:
a Dodge Monaco with a 440 Police Interceptor = Turbo Boost. They managed to 
get that 5000 pound pig up to speeds over 130 mph in those scenes....it was 
filmed in real time according to John Landis...the pedestrian scenes were 
added in later
comments.author: netrioter

comments.author: David Sebelius (Davsvidfan02)

comments.text:
Although this one of the most comical car chases of cinema, it really does 
reveal how awesome Elwood is at driving, as well as a striking contrast 
between genuinely good stunt driving and how the filmmakers were trying to 
parody car chases of the time...

0:35 Compensating for the Dodge's massive weight shift after the slalom, 
perhaps a bit too much?
0:50 A little help from God 
1:20 Elwood makes it through the next turn at this speed and the cops don't 
because he moves to the outside lane and then cuts over the median to get 
the best apex for that corner
2:20 The only thing Elwood couldn't avoid before having to turn﻿
comments.author: Cherry Voodoo

comments.text:
One of the greatest movies of all time. My Dad sat with me to watch it, ill 
sit with my son to watch it.﻿
comments.author: emaswat900

comments.text:
I bought one of those Monaco's at an auction after the movie I had tons of 
fun with it till I sold it to a friend who smashed it into a wall. :(  Most 
of those Monaco's ended up at a junk yard in the Burr ridge area near the 
cal sag canal and Archer Ave. Sweet memories :)﻿
